column4: anyone know how to mount a .bin file? it asks me to specify filesystem type, i usually use '-o loop', and using '-o bin' doesnt work (tells me to use loop instead)
not all .bin files are mountable
-2 doesnt seem to work, it doesnt look like a valid parameter (-s)
are you sure you got the command right?
file -s file.bin
not mount .. file  :)
we're trying to find out what type of .bin file this is
as i said earlier, not all .bin files are mountable, in other words, they are not always images of filesystems - some are executable programs, some are binary data, etc
it returned "data"  XD not ery informative
where did you get this file from?
it won't tell you the filesystem -- but it could give you something more informative, but as you saw, not always
so where did you get this file from?
Torrent from TPB I believe, there is also a .cue with it
http://www.ubuntusky.com/2007/04/16/how-to-mount-or-burn-a-bin-image/ maybe this helps
did you try mounting with the -t iso9660 option?
before or after conerting to iso?
before -- and not relating to converting the iso
sudo mount -t iso9660 file.bin /path/to/mountpoint
-t iso9660 reports 'is not a block device'
hmm, not sure then, the file could be damaged/corrupted -- but try converting it to an ISO
Thanks for the help, I got it! converted to an iso, then used -o loop
cool
